modules.description: This module handles text formatting and output generation with functions for string manipulation, width calculation, and styled text rendering. It works with strings, format formatters, and optional styling parameters such as color, icon, and scale. Concrete use cases include generating accessible text output, rendering status messages with custom styling, and maintaining a counter for ordered output elements.

Handles icon rendering and formatting with support for optional labels, scaling, and positioning. Works with strings and tuples containing optional strings, floats, and units. Used to generate formatted output for UI components or visual elements requiring labeled icons with adjustable size and placement.

This module defines a set of common color values and supports conversion from strings to these color values. It includes a custom color variant for arbitrary string-based colors and provides pretty-printing for color values. It is used to represent and display colors in terminal output or logging systems.

Represents formatting styles for output, with variants `Classic` and `Flat`. Converts string values to corresponding style types using `of_string`. Useful for configuring output layout in command-line tools or log formatters.

Contains a single value `table` representing a precomputed array of floating-point numbers. Designed for efficient lookup of numerical data, particularly in contexts requiring fast access to a fixed set of float values. Useful in mathematical computations or data-driven algorithms where a static float array improves performance.

This module organizes submodules for structured text and data formatting. It includes operations for color representation, styled text generation, icon rendering, optional value handling, output style configuration, and static float array lookup. These components support tasks like terminal output styling, UI element formatting, and performance-critical numerical computations.
